alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:51PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 1015 PM MDT... At 951 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Sugarite, or 10 miles east of Raton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Colfax County. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 355 and 365, and between Mile Markers 367 and 375. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
